definition: lit. to nurture one's years (idiom)/fig. to enjoy one's later years
to die before one's allotted lifespan has run its course (idiom)

sentences.english: Sixteen thousand such heavenly years constitute the life-span among the devas who have power over the creations of others.
sentences.chinese: 如此一万六千天年，为他化自在天天神的寿命。

sentences.english: Old age is also full of life pleasure in the communist world.
sentences.chinese: 共产世界的老年人同样充满天年的生活乐趣。

sentences.english: La Boétie notes that the tyrant and his chiefs rarely live out their natural ends.
sentences.chinese: 拉博埃蒂指出暴君以及他的主要帮凶很少活到天年。

sentences.english: Then look I death my days should expiate.
sentences.chinese: 我就盼死神来了结我的天年。

definition: lit. to nurture one's years (idiom)/fig. to enjoy one's later years
to die of old age/to live to a ripe old age/(fig.) (of sth) to come to an end (after a long period of service)
to foster/to provide care (esp. for the elderly)
see 駕鶴西去|驾鹤西去[jia4 he4 xi1 qu4]
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
lit. to play with one's grandchildren while eating candy (idiom)/fig. to enjoy a happy and leisurely old age
to prevent or treat a disease
